Description: Body fragment of Attic red-figured pottery open vase, probably a krater. Inside glazed; outside, female, moving quickly to right, holding a torch or thyrsos in her lowered right hand.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 101 no. 347 pl. 74)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1027)
